newsitem.title: JAPAN: MOF minister says to cooperate in BOJ law revision.
newsitem.headline: MOF minister says to cooperate in BOJ law revision.

text.p: Finance Minister Hiroshi Mitsuzuka was quoted as telling Prime Minister Ryutaro Hashimoto on Tuesday that his ministry will get to work immediately to put into action proposals for revising the Bank of Japan law.
An advisory panel to Hashimoto earlier proposed giving the BOJ more freedom in forming monetary policy through the revision of the 54-year-old law governing the central bank.

A senior Ministry of Finance official told reporters that Hashimoto reiterated to Mitsuzuka that his government needs to put into action the panel's proposals on revising the BOJ law as soon as possible, and asked the ministry to submit the necessary bills to the next ordinary session of parliament.
Following Hashimoto's request, Mitsuzuka instructed the MOF's panel on reforming Japan's financial system to meet on November 19 to discuss the BOJ law revision in detail, the official said.
